perturbation.original_text: Late payments shall accrue interest at a rate equal to fifteen (15%) percent per annum.
perturbation.changed_text: Late payments shall accrue interest at a rate equal to twenty-five (25%) percent per annum.
perturbation.explanation: New York usury laws limit the permissible interest rate on debts. Charging 25% per annum may violate these laws if it exceeds the legal limit for the type of debt involved, creating a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Obligations Law ยง 5-501; New York Banking Law ยง 14-a

perturbation.original_text: Tadeo shall have the right (but not the obligation) to terminate this Agreement and the rights granted to Diplomat hereunder if: (i) Diplomat is in material breach of any of its obligations hereunder, which breach is not cured within five days of receipt of written notice from Tadeo of such breach;
perturbation.changed_text: Tadeo shall have the right (but not the obligation) to terminate this Agreement and the rights granted to Diplomat hereunder if: (i) Diplomat is in material breach of any of its obligations hereunder, which breach is not cured within two days of receipt of written notice from Tadeo of such breach;
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for a material breach to two days may be deemed unreasonably short, especially considering the complexity of potential breaches. This could conflict with the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under New York law, which requires parties to act reasonably in exercising their contractual rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Uniform Commercial Code ยง 1-304

perturbation.original_text: Diplomat will be required to notify Tadeo at least five business days before the date of planned examination. If Diplomat's examination is not completed within one month from commencement, Tadeo at any time may require Diplomat to terminate such examination on seven days' notice to Diplomat; PROVIDED that Tadeo has cooperated with Diplomat in the examination of such books and records.
perturbation.changed_text: Diplomat will be required to notify Tadeo at least one business day before the date of planned examination. If Diplomat's examination is not completed within one week from commencement, Tadeo at any time may require Diplomat to terminate such examination immediately; PROVIDED that Tadeo has cooperated with Diplomat in the examination of such books and records.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for examination of records to one business day, and the time allowed to complete the exam to one week is unreasonable. This might be considered an impediment to Diplomat's right to audit the books, potentially conflicting with principles of good faith and fair dealing, and preventing proper oversight.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Uniform Commercial Code ยง 1-304
